result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtiss W Boutwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtiss W Boutwell

records.addlTxt:
09:44 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Curtiss W Boutwell in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Mastantuono provides an update, he notes the State is willing to amend to a citation.  State confirms, they move to amend the charge to County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct 13-102(c)(8), with the domestic abuse enhancer struck and will ask for a fine of $50.00 plus costs.  Atty. Mastantuono will accept the offer and will enter a no contest plea on behalf of his client to the amended charge.  Court will accept the plea of no contest to the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct, County Ordinance, and will find the defendant guilty.  Court will order a $50.00 fine plus costs.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $267.50;
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 05/12/2022:  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is allowed to have non-in person work related contact with witness B only.

PREVIOUSLY ORDERED CONDITIONS: Defendant to have no violent contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

08:50 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Defendant Curtiss W Boutwell in court by Zoom video with attorney Craig Mastantuono, who also appeared by Zoom video.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court notes the matter was set over to today to allow time for the State to verify the letter was actually filed by the victims with respect to defense's motion to modify bail.  State confirms they have verified with the victims that they are in agreement with a no violent contact order.  State also has no objection to the request.  Court will order the conditions of bail modified to No violent contact with Victim A & B.  Court notes there is also a no contact order with witness B.  Atty. Mastantuono advises he forwarded a letter to ADA Woller from Witness B with respect to the no contact order as well, and is asking that be modified also.  State has no objection.  Court will also modify conditions as follows: Defendant is allowed to have non-in person work related contact with witness B only.  Court advises Defendant will need to come to the courthouse to sign the amended bond by end of business on 5/13/2022.  Court inquires how the matter will be proceeding.  Atty. Mastantuono provides an update and is asking for a plea and sentencing date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for May 16, 2022.
Bail/bond hearing on May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:45 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Curtiss W Boutwell in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Mastantuono provides an update, he is requesting a projected plea date as he is working with the State to reslove the matter.  Atty. Mastantuono also notes he filed a motion to modify bail and would like it to be addressed today if possible.  Court inquires if the State has been able to do victim notification to address the motion today.  State advises they have not, but as the motion was brought about at the victims' request the State has no objection to the motion being addressed today and will take no position.  Court inquires if the State has proof that the victims are asking for the bail modification.  Atty. Mastantuono advises he has forwarded a copy of the motion and letter from the victims to the DA's office with the hope they would verify the victims' position.  State is not sure if they will be able to reach out to the victims this morning and get a response.  Atty. Mastantuono requests a short adjournment to hear the bail motion.  Court adjourns for hearing on the bail motion.  Court will allow defendant and counsel to appear by Zoom for this hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the Victims with respect to defense's motion to modify bail; letter was filed by Atty. Mastantuono.

Defendant's Motion for Bail Modification;  filed by Atty. Craig Mastantuono;  
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 05/11/2022:  We will discuss on 5/11
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
